npc.1: I'm looking forward to working with you.
npc.3: Thank you for your hard work.
npc.303: So, which piece of equipment do you want to improve?

npc.308: This looks good! The improvement was successful!
npc.309: I'm sorry... I couldn't improve it...
npc.310: It's possible to upgrade this equipment into something better!
npc.312: Welcome. How may I help you?
npc.313: So it's gonna be this one?
npc.314: Are you sure you want this?
npc.317: Admiral, thanks for your continued support!
npc.318: Please give Large Ship Construction a try when you have a surplus of resources and materials!
npc.321: It's Setsubun, I'll do my best. Come on everyone, you too!
npc.323: This season just makes you want to eat some mysterious curry.
npc.324: Demons begone! Fortune welcome! Take this!
npc.325: I think that I feel very good.
npc.402: Admiral, the operation was successful. Just as expected!
npc.406: What would you like to do?
npc.407: Admiral, please carry out these operations.
npc.408: Admiral, the time has come to move on to a new operation.
npc.412: The second part of the operation.
npc.414: I will now summarize the operation plan.
npc.415: This is the first operational area operation plan.
npc.416: This is the second operational area operation plan.
npc.417: This is the third operational area operation plan.
npc.418: This is the fourth operational area operation plan.
npc.419: This is the fifth operational area operation plan.
npc.420: This is the sixth operational area operation plan.
npc.421: This is the final operational area operation plan.
npc.422: This operational area will involve sortieing a combined fleet.
npc.423: The main focus of this operation is a transport operation.
npc.424: It is possible to execute a joint operation with land-based air squadrons.

npc.427: Admiral, congratulations! All operational areas have been successfully captured. The operation was a success.

428.1760: Fusou: "Force C of the 1st Striking Force, 2nd Squadron, has...
428.54960: There really is... no rain that doesn't stop... is there?

npc.430: Musashi: "It's over, partner. Our Combined Fleet, the 1st Striking Force, yes, the Kurita Fleet, has annihilated the enemy fleet! Yeeeeeaaaaaaah!"
npc.431: Zuikaku: "Operation Sho-1 is completed! Alright! We did it, everyone!"
npc.432: Shoukaku: "Zuikaku, Admiral, good work. I'll be with you forever..."
npc.433: Musashi: "Right, now I can finally get some rest. Let me stay beside you a while, partner. *sigh* Now I can rest. Thank... you..."

434.21500: Even if the light fades and the wind ceases.
434.33500: The moonlit sky we look upon, will always be shining.
434.45200: This night, these stars, will keep revolving.
434.50500: That winter night when you called on me.
434.62000: But still, the moon will be there.
434.73700: The time when I walked with you still shines in my heart.
434.84200: Running, falling down, declaring our love to each other.
434.96000: The blooming flowers in our hearts, are blooming like a wave in spring.
434.107000: Laughing or crying, everything is a miracle with you.
434.132600: I'll always believe in the gentle future you wish for.
434.143600: When the summer night falls, it's the time when everything disappears.
434.155300: Watching the moon with you as the night wind scatters petals around us.
434.166400: Laughing or crying, these are very precious memories.

npc.435: Zuikaku: "Admiral, Shoukaku, thank you. I'll always love you."

1101.0: Wakaba: "DesDiv 21, action stations! I, Wakaba, shall be the commanding destroyer. Everyone, what's your status?"
1101.10100: Nenohi: "Oh wow, Wakaba, didn't expect you to be so eager! Nenohi, at action station. Look, I'm here~!"
1101.18300: Hatsuharu: "Oh my goodness gracious, are you noisy! Of course we are ready to weigh anchor whenever you are."
1101.26300,37200: Hatsushimo: "Y-yes! Hatsushimo, present! Wakaba, All ships of DesDiv 21 are ready to sortie!"

1158.0: Nagato: "Battleship Nagato, preparation complete! Mutsu, what about you?"
1158.4900,10500: Mutsu: "Sorry to keep you waiting, Nagato! Remodelled Nagato-class battleship, Mutsu, taking position!"

1186.3590: Arashio: "My, my~ You're rea~lly looking forward to this."
1186.7980: Asashio: "Alright! Commander— remodeled DesDiv 8, all ships assembled!"
1186.15380,19532: Asashio: "Eighth Destroyer Division— sortie preparations: complete!"

1187.0: Michishio: "Why was I assigned to a fleet like this...?"
1187.3250: Shigure: "Ah... Michishio. Nice to see you."
1187.7340: Michishio: "Shigure!? You're... What are you doing here?"
1187.13020: Michishio: "Don't tell me we're in the same unit?"
1187.15550: Shigure: "Looks like it... First Striking Force... Force C..."
1187.22670: Michishio: "Shigure? What's the matter with you?"
1187.26360: Michishio: "You're looking pale. Do you need to lie down?"
1187.30280:
Shigure: "It's nothing to worry about! ...Yeah.
I guess the rain is getting to me."

1188.0: Fusou: "Yamashiro, we of BatDiv 2 have been assigned as the main force of the First Striking Force, Third Section."
1188.11310: Yamashiro: "Yes, Nee-sama! I, Yamashiro, shall serve as flagship of the Third Section, the Nishimura Fleet!"
1188.20440: Shigure: "Yeah. We will sail ahead as screen against enemy torpedo squadrons."

1189.0: Murasame: "Ufufufu♪ Did you want me to really show you some of my good points?"
1189.7500: Yura: "Murasame-san, I'll be counting on that, okay? On behalf of DesRon 4, would you please do so in the upcoming battle?"
1189.24500: Yuudachi: "Poi~! I wanna come along too, poi!"
1189.29000,36400: Murasame: "Murasame, assuming command of the 4th Torpedo Squadron. Now, shall we head out?"

1190.0: Wakaba: "DesDiv 21, action stations! I, Wakaba, shall be the commanding destroyer. Everyone, what's your status?"
1190.10700: Hatsuharu: "Oh my goodness gracious, are you noisy! Of course we are ready to weigh anchor whenever you are."

1191.0: Urakaze: "17th Destroyer Division, all present and accounted for. Isokaze, your radiance is truly superb!"
1191.8000: Hamakaze: "No problems on this end. How about you, Tanikaze?"
1191.14000: Tanikaze: "Oh? What's up? You calling for me? Hmm, what, you should know, I'm always in battle formation!"
1191.26000: Urakaze: "Admiral, we've finished makin' preparations, we're ready 'ta go at any time."

1195.0: Urakaze: "DesDiv 17, all here! Oh look at you, Isokaze, with that lovely smile!"
1195.8300: Hamakaze: "No problems here. What about Tanikaze?"
1195.13300: Tanikaze: "Uuh, helloooo? I'm also here. Yep, totally here. Hey, Hamakaze. Hey~! Ha~ma~ka~ze~!"
1195.25800: Hamakaze: "Yes, looks like no problems on her end..."
1195.29500: Urakaze: "Admiral, we're ready to sortie. Just say the word."

Intro.3850,7292: Leave the enemy battleships to me.

Library.0: The first battleship born under the Eight-Eight Fleet Program and nameship of the Nagato-class battleships, Nagato here.
Library.6970: Until the Yamato-class was commissioned, I served as the flagship of the Combined Fleet.
Library.11980,15355: I was known around the world as one of the "Big Seven".

80.Poke(2): Is there something on my face?
80.Poke(3): I'd prefer it if you wouldn't touch my rigging so much.
80.Married: It'll be fine... I'm right here beside you.

Wedding.1300: What is this vision, deep inside my memories?
Wedding.5470: Ships, both friend and foe... and then...

80.Equip(1): My thanks. Now I can fight on their level.
80.Equip(2): Modernization, huh? I don't really need it, though...
80.Supply: My thanks. Now I can fight on their level.
80.Docking(1): A little bit of maintenance is essential.
80.Docking(2): I'd prefer to enter the decisive battle in perfect condition.
80.Construction: It seems a new comrade has been launched. Looking forward to meeting her.
80.Return: Mission complete. The fleet has returned.
80.Battle: Don't underestimate the power of the Big Seven.
80.Attack: The long-awaited decisive battle, huh. I'm getting all excited.
80.Yasen(1): Alright! Fleet, I, Nagato, shall lead the way!
80.Yasen(2): All main batteries, full salvo! Fiiiiire!
80.MVP: Compared to the glory of serving as the Combined Fleet's flagship, this is insignificant, but I'll accept... it.
80.Damaged(2): The Nagato-class' armor isn't just for show.
80.Damaged(3): Ngh... The enemy fleet is pretty good...
80.Sunk: To sink in the midst of battle... and not in that light... how satisfying...
80.Friend41(1): Alright! All guns ready! Full broadside, FIRE!
80.2@NewYears: Happy New Year, huh... it makes my heart swell.
80.2@Setsubun: Setsubun, huh... I'm willing to play the demon... No, these are absolutely not horns! Ah... hey, the destroyers are already throwing at me! Well, I guess I have no choice... ROAAARR!!
80.2@Valentines: Uh... um, that is... I happened to make some. N-No, it was Mutsu's idea, ok? Saying that these things are important... Ah... how does it... what do you think?
80.2@Anniversary3: It has been three years for us. How thrilling... Right. Today, let's open our naval shop magnificently! I see, It's the third year... Time sure flies...
80.2@Rainy: Mutsu. ...What's this? An umbrella? ....Ah, much appreciated. Rain in the rainy season, huh...? Well, a calm day like this once in a while isn't bad sometimes....
80.2@EarlySummer: Alright! Summer is here! Fleet, assemble at the beach with your swimsuits! We're going to practice 'beach volleyball'! I, Nagato, have already set the teams!
80.2@Xmas: So this is... Christmas, huh... Hmm... I see.
80.3@Xmas: Admiral, you're always working so hard. Let's have a drink together today.
80.2@YearsEnd: It's already December, huh... A year passed in the blink of an eye. Hm? What is it, Mutsu? Eh? ...Cleaning? I'll be doing that, too? Ah, guess there's no avoiding it, huh. Well then, I'll get the floor!
80.2@WhiteDay: What's this? So this is... the return gift that I'd heard from Mutsu?! My thanks. This is something that warms the heart, isn't it... I shall accept it. I'm happy!
80.2@Saury2017: Humph, saury fishing, huh. Leave it to me. Somehow my body feels like supporting the fishing industry. Yup, I'll show you my power!
80.2@Anniversary2018: What was that!? It's already the fleet's 5th Anniversary? I see. That really fires me up. Thank you.
80.2@Anniversary2019: It's finally our 6th Anniversary. I'm feeling excited. Alright, let's give a grand welcome to today with my main guns. Really, the 6th Anniversary. Well, it sure came quickly.

275.Intro: I, Nagato, am not about to lose to some newcomers.
275.Poke(3): W-Wha... n-no... I-I don't mind... it...
275.Idle: Hm? What? It's not like I have too much time on my hands or anything. Yes, indeed. I am so busy...
275.Supply: That's true. I should eat while I have the chance.
275.H0000: Alright, today, I, Nagato, will be your secretary ship. You can rest easy and leave it all to me.
275.H0200: It's 0200. What's wrong, Admiral? Are you tired? Me? I have no problem.
275.H0300: It's 0300. The night is still long. What? Tea? Sorry for the trouble, Admiral. Thanks, I'll have some.
275.H0400: 0400. I'll make the tea this time. Don't worry, leave it to me. Tea should be easy to...hm. Um, the tea leaves are...
275.H0500: It's 0500. Soon it will be dawn. Hn hnnnnnn *stretching*... Dawn feels great.
275.H0600: 0600. Fleet, wake up! It's morning, wake up! Alright, go wash your faces and look sharp!
275.H0700: It's 0700. Alright, let's make a quick breakfast and get to our stations. Bukkake rice is alright, right? Let's eat!
275.H0800: 0800. Alright, to help with digestion, let's do our fleet exercises. First Battleship Division assemble! Begin artillery exercises!
275.H0900: It's 0900. Yes. Moving your body in the morning feels great! Hahahahaha! How about you Admiral? Hmm?
275.H1000: 100... Oh it's you Mutsu. What? There's no problem here. Oh, this is? ... Ah, lunch. Yes, thanks.
275.H1100: It's 1100. It will be lunchtime soon. Let's eat the rice balls Mutsu made for us. Yes.
275.H1200: 1200. It's lunch. Yes. It's lunchtime. Rice balls eaten on the sea are delicious, there is nothing like it. There's tea as well.
275.H1300: It's 1300. Alright, let's do our best in the afternoon as well! Let's do a lot of exercises with the Yamatos! Right!
275.H1400: 1400. Yamato, Musashi let's go! It's time for the fleet exercises. Let's give it our all! No holding back!
275.H1500: 1500. What? The Eight-eight fleet? Yes, that's right. I was made for that purpose. Well, that's an old story. Heh.
275.H1600: It's 1600. Hmph. You're right, getting food provisions is important. ...what? Whales? Hmm, hmph. I see.
275.H1700: 1700. The sun is setting. I wonder why, Admiral, it's beautiful but it feels a little sad as well.
275.H1800: It's 1800. It's dinner time. Leave it to.... What, Admiral, you're making it? Oh, I see. Alright, I'll be waiting.
275.H1900: 1900. *sniff* Hm? It has a nice smell. It looks professionally made. Is it all right if I eat? Yes. Alright, let's eat!
275.H2000: It's 2000. Yes, this is good! The Admiral's cooking is as good as Yamato's. You sure did great!
275.H2100: 210... It's noisy, is it the 3rd Torpedo Squadron? *sigh* It's alright to be energetic but...I'll have to have a few words with her.
275.H2200: 22... Oh, Warspite, what's the matter? .... Ah, some cake for us. Thanks, I'll accept it.
275.H2300: It's 2300. Admiral, thanks for your hard work today. Rest your body a bit and prepare for the fight tomorrow. Good night.

541.Intro: The remodeled Nagato won't lose to the newcomers. Let's go!
541.Join: First Battleship Division, flagship Nagato, sortieing!
541.Equip(2): This equipment is... Yes. I'll be even stronger.
541.Battle: Don't underestimate the power of the remodeled Big Seven.
541.SpCutin: Let's do this! Full broadside! FIRE!!!!!!!
541.SpCCutin(1): Mutsu, leave it all to me! FIRE!!!
541.SpCCutin(2): Mutsu, follow me! First fleet, attack! Main guns, full broadside! FIRE!!!
541.SpCCutin(3): Nelson? Interesting. Let's do this! FIRE!!!

81.Intro: Second of the Nagato-class battleships, Mutsu. Pleased to meet you. Don't play with fire too much, okay? ...Please?
81.Library:
Second of the Nagato-class battleships to have been born, Mutsu.

Naturally, I'm a part of the world's Big Seven ships.

Eh? The main cannon gunpowder explosion incident? Well, I guess there's no point in hiding it. This time will be fine!
81.Poke(3): Like I said, be careful with that or you'll start a fire inside of me! Hey, are you listening?
81.Married: Since it's for you, dear, I'll do my best today as well, okay?

Wedding.1210: Why do you keep looking at my third turret?
Wedding.5200,8252: If you want to look, look over here♥

81.Equip(1): My, it's fine. It's not like anything will happen, you know?
81.Equip(2): Hmm...? Not bad, right? Thank you.
81.Supply: My, it's fine. It's not like anything will happen, you know?
81.Docking(1): I'll be fixing my makeup for a bit.
81.Docking(2): My clothes were ruined. Would you mind...?
81.Construction: Looks like a new warship has been built.
81.Sortie: So it's my turn? Sounds good. I'll let them have it!
81.Battle: Enemy ship spotted! Open all gunports!
81.Yasen(1): Well then, let's deliver the final blow.
81.Yasen(2): Third turret... what are you doing?
81.MVP: My, it was me? Hmm...? So even something like that can happen. It doesn't feel bad at all.
81.Sunk: Sinking in battle... I wonder why... I don't feel any regrets...
81.2@NewYears: Admiral? Happy New Year! Please treat me well again this year! Oh, and also, please take good care of Nagato. That girl can be a little awkward at times, you know?
81.2@Setsubun: Eh? I'm also a demon? That's fine, but... I see. These aren't demon horns, you know? Eh? So Nagato is really getting into this? I guess I have no choice...
81.2@Valentines: Heeere~ Admiral. It's a bit of a mature chocolate. Here you go. Make sure you eat it, okay? Ufufu♪
81.2@Anniversary3: Oh! Oh my! It's the third anniversary! Amazing that it still goes on. I'm a bit surprised over it. Oh, that's not what I meant. I meant well.
81.2@Rainy: Ah, Nagato, are you going out? Bring this umbrella along. It's going to continue all day today. The rain, that is.
81.2@EarlySummer2015: What is it, Nagato? Beach volleyball? That's okay, but... do you know the rules? My, my, it can't be helped. Leave it to me!
81.2@Fall: The battle seems like it'll be a little big this time. We may have to sortie with all of our strength. We need to be prepared. I also need to put a bit more energy into my makeup. One moment.
81.2@YearsEnd: Well, the end of the year always ends up so busy. Let's get the cleaning done early. Ufufu♪ Nagato, won't you please take care of this area?
81.2@WhiteDay: Oh my, is that your return gift? I'm happy.
81.2@EarlySummer: How does this yukata look, Nagato? Does it look strange? That's fine then. Thanks for waiting, Admiral. Ufufu~ Thank you.
81.2@Saury2017: Saury Fishing Support Operation, roger that. Oh my♪ You're sparkling, Nagato. You want to go fishing? I see♪
81.2@Spring2019: Nagato, what do you think of having a cherry blossom viewing with the 1st Fleet? We can invite Yamato and Musashi too. Right? It sounds fun, doesn't it? I'll go talk with the Admiral.
81.3@Anniversary2019: Oh my, my, my. It's the 6th Anniversary? Amazing. They just keep coming. Nagato, Admiral, please keep looking after me.

276.Intro: I'm the 2nd ship of the Nagato-class battleships, Mutsu. Admiral, I look forward to working with you today too. Please don't play with fire alright. Please?
276.Poke(1): My my, do you need something?
276.Poke(2): Like I said, be careful with that or you'll start a fire inside of me! Hey, are you listening?
276.Poke(3): Didn't I tell you not to get a fire burning...? Eh? You're serious? Hmm~ then Onee-san... won't be held responsible♥
276.Idle: My... my, my. You're leaving me all by my lonesome... My, oh, my!
276.Ranking: Information? Wait a minute. Big sis will get it for you.
276.H0000: The date has changed. Oh my, so I'm the secretary today. That's fine. Just leave it all to big sis. The night is long.
276.H0100: It's 0100. It's so quiet now. Even though it's so busy during the day. It just amazes me.
276.H0200: It's 0200. Should I make some tea? You prefer coffee? Is that so?
276.H0300: It's 0300. Would you like more coffee? Ok, wait a minute. I wonder if I should make it a bit stronger.
276.H0400: Ngggggh *stretching*... It's 0400. It's almost morning. Dear, it's fine for you to take a short rest. It's fine, I'll keep an eye on things.
276.H0500: It's 0500. Mmmm, it's a lovely morning. Would you like more coffee? I'll go and make some. Yes, wait a minute.
276.H0600: It's 0600. I'll go and wake everyone up, alright? It's fine, you just get some rest... alright? I'll wake Nagato and the others up, alright?
276.H0700: It's 0700. Admiral, Nagato, good morning. Breakfast is set out over here. Mutsu Morning! Please enjoy.
276.H0800: It's 0800. I'll make some rice balls for lunch, alright? Nagato wants salmon and okaka... What would you like, Admiral? Well?
276.H0900: It's 0900. Oh my, Nagato, you're being too enthusiastic. Don't get too far ahead. Right, Admiral?
276.H1000: It's 1000. Nagato, take this. It's rice balls for lunch. I made lots. Here's your share too, Admiral. Alright?
276.H1100: It's 1100. The sea definitely feels great, right? Hmm? Admiral, what's wrong? Is there something on my face?
276.H1200: It's 1200. Let's have lunch. Here, this is your share, Admiral. I made too much. Mmm, don't force yourself to finish it.
276.H1300: It's 1300. Admiral, would you like another cup of tea? Really? Roger. Let's work hard this afternoon too.
276.H1400: 140... Oh, Kaga! Eh, have I changed my makeup? It's still the same as usual. Ah, is that so? My, oh my.
276.H1500: It's 1500. That's right! We have some delicious castella from Kyoto. Admiral, would you like some? Ok, roger that. I'll make some tea too, alright?
276.H1600: 16... Oh, it's the girls from DesDiv7. What's wrong? My my, that's... not quite right. I'm alright. I mean, look... I'm feeling fine.
276.H1700: It's 1700. Admiral, look at the sunset. It's beautiful... Eh, me? Ah, jeez, flattery won't get you anywhere... But, I'm happy.
276.H1800: It's 1800. You're going to make dinner, Admiral? No, let me do it. Just leave it to me. Is there anything you'd like to have?
276.H1900: 1900. Thanks for waiting. Today I made my special Western Dinner Course. For the drink... is red wine fine with you?
276.H2000: It's 2000. So how did I do? Eh, it wouldn't lose to Yamato? Jeez, flattery really won't get you anywhere!
276.H2100: It's 2100. Oh, Nelson! How are you? Are you settling in? ...Oh my, tell me if you have anything troubling you, alright?
276.H2200: 22... Oh, Akagi. Eh, refreshments? Thank you. Hey, how about you have a drink with us if you don't mind? Just once in a while. Yup!
276.H2300: It's 2300. Hey, Admiral, there's a saying that goes "no one knows the truth of this world". Such a mysterious saying. You should get a bit of rest, Admiral. Goodnight.

573.Intro: I'm the 2nd ship of the Improved Nagato-class battleships, Mutsu. Admiral, I look forward to working with you today too. Please don't play with fire... Hmmm? Really? Ufufu. Well that makes me feel better.

131.Intro:

I am at your service!

First of the Yamato-class battleships, Yamato here.

As the trump card of the Decisive Battle Doctrine, I was built in absolute secrecy at the Kure Naval Arsenal.

With what was then the most advanced and sophisticated technology inside of me, and alongside the second ship, Musashi, I will do my best as the backbone of the Combined Fleet's war potential!

131.2@Summer: Admiral, please don't stare so much! Maybe red and white was a little too flashy...? I-Is that so? Well then, that's a relief. Admiral, let's go together.
131.2@Fall: Admiral, it's fall. Fall is a time for delicious food. I've also come up with a "New Full Course".
131.2@Saury: Saury? This is saury fishing support? Orders understood. The battleship Yamato will accompany you to the northern seas!
131.2@Xmas: Merry Christmas! Admiral, I put my full power into making a special Christmas dinner! I've roasted us a turkey. H-Huh? Zuikaku-san...?
131.2@YearsEnd: Houshou-san, where does this go... Ah, over there right? Roger that. Haa, spring cleaning is hard work. Admiral, just leave everything to me and don't worry alright?
131.2@Spring: Spring is just around the corner, huh... Ufufu. Watching the cherry blossoms really gives me a mysterious feeling. Eh? These are... tears? Why...?

131.2@WhiteDay: Admiral! Is it alright for Yamato to take these? I'm sorry. Thank you very much. I humbly accept. I'll do my best next year!

131.2@LateFall2017: Musashi? What's wrong? Are you cold? Is there something wrong with your engine room? I see, that's fine then. Let me know if anything happens, alright?
131.3@Valentines2018: Now, dessert will be my special heart-shaped chocolate cake. Alright, it's done! Now, I need to call the Admiral. Admiral! Admiral~! Huh, where's Admiral?
131.2@Anniversary2018: The fleet's 5th Anniversary is finally here, Admiral. Congratulations. I'm also very grateful. Let's celebrate with ramune... no, wine and a full course!
131.3@Anniversary2019: Admiral, the fleet has reached it's 6th Anniversary. My sincerest congratulations. I'm grateful. I'm happy too. I'll put my all into making a celebratory full course.

546.H0900: It's 9 o'clock. Ah, what is it, Yamato? Ah, I'm fine. I'm doing well with my partner. Don't worry. Hmm? Really?
546.H1000: 10 o'clock, huh. Hmm? Yamato? No, she's a good girl, but her one flaw is she does become a busybody sometimes. Er, not that I mind, really.
546.H1400: 2pm. Yeah, I'm still hungry... What is that, Shigure? A "Sasebo Burger"? I see, so this is it! Om! Nom! That's delicious, this is good. Sasebo is pretty good in this era.
546.H1600: 4pm. Hmm, what's wrong, Yamato? Ah? You're... Iowa? Haven't heard of you. You'll have to face me before Yamato. Ah, an exercise is fine. Now, bring it!
546.H1800: 6pm. I should make dinner once in a while. Ah, but don't expect too much. I know, I'll make curry.
546.H1900: I made it. How is it? It's my special curry. Oh, Kiyoshimo. You have some too! Eat up and become a fine person. The time? Ah, it's 7 o'clock.
546.H2000: 8pm. Is Maya doing her job properly? I see, Choukai is with her. That's a relief, yep.
546.H2100: 9pm. Hmm? What is it, Shimakaze? I'm alright. Yes, you're always looking lively. Haha, that's right!
546.H2200: 10pm. Hard jobs are also part of the mission. What's wrong, Hamakaze, Kiyoshimo? Yep, I'm still in good health. I... see, that's right.
546.H2300: It's already 11pm. Hmph, take the night battle nice and easy, partner. What's that? You're so eager. Heheh, just so eager.

446.H1200: 12:00 PM. For today's primo piatto we have seafood pasta. For secondo we have meat. Contorno is important too. As for wine... is red wine ok?
446.H1300: 13:00... PM. Eh... That's too much for lunch? I'm sorry. I'll reduce the amount of food in our dinner.
446.H1400: 14:00 PM. Well, let us give our best this afternoon! Which area shall our fleet advance? Western?
446.H1500: 15:00... PM. The Japanese's fast battleship is not bad. They're wonderful.
446.H1600: 16:00... PM. That battleship... has such an artistic superstructure... Her bridge is a work of art.
446.H1700: 17:00... PM. Admiral, the sunset in Japan is beautiful. It's the same in Mediterranean Sea too.
446.H1800: 18:00... PM. Well, it's about time to prepare for dinner. Which wine shall we have? White wine or red wine? Shall we go with white wine then?
446.H1900: 19:00 PM. I've brought you dinner, please dig in! Also here's your wine. Whoa! What a wonderful way of drinking.
446.H2000: 20:00 PM. Admiral, I shall open the red wine next. Uhm... which one should I open... Ah! Do you like cheese? Or dolce?
446.H2100: 21:00 PM. Admiral, you're good. I'm happy to be worthy of making all those food you have eaten.
446.H2200: 22:00... PM. I'm a little worried about Roma... I'm sorry Admiral. I will check on her.
446.H2300: 23:00 PM. Don't worry, Roma is doing fine. Am I worrying too much? I'm sorry.
446.2@Xmas: Buone Feste! Admiral, Merry Christmas! Here. It's my present to you. *♥*

442.Intro: I'm the fourth battleship of the Vittorio Veneto-class, Roma. Nice to meet you. What? Please don't stare at me, okay?
442.Library: The Italian-made, state of the art warship. Fourth of the Vittorio Veneto class battleships, Roma. Yes, I was together with my elder sister at that time. The day those monsters were dropped. I won't forget that pain. I absolutely won't forget it.
442.Poke(1): Buon giorno. Did you call for Roma?
442.Poke(2): Admiral, do you have an order for Roma? Oh, then that's fine.
442.Poke(3): What's that Admiral?　The way you touch the left area around my deck is unforgivable. Can I give you the counterattack?
442.Idle: Damn that bomber... you better remember this! Ah, Admiral? What? I didn't say anything. None at all. Aren't you just hearing things? Come on, work first work first.
442.Married: What, Admiral? You seem free. How about becoming my partner then? Ah, of course that's not what I meant. We're just talking a walk over there, a walk. Let's go.

Wedding.0: What? Even though I look like this, I'm actually busy.

442.Ranking: Confirming the information? Well that's important.
442.Join: Battleship Roma, sortieing. I'm going first, sister.
442.Equip(1): Japanese improvement... Well that's good too, thanks.
442.Equip(2): Grazie. With this... maybe I will become better with this.
442.Supply: Grazie. I'm gonna go again, you can count on me.
442.Docking(1): I'm going to need a little repair. What? Don't stare at me.
442.Docking(2): Um, for me to be at the dock... well that's fine... Tsk, I already said to not stare at me!
442.Construction: Admiral, looks like a new ship is ready to join the battle line.
442.Return: The fleet has returned. What is it? Please, don't stare at me too much.
442.Sortie: Roma of the Vittorio Veneto-class, starting! I'm serious, follow me!
442.Battle: Enemy fleet sighted! Commencing artillery fire. Here we go... Open all the gunports!
442.Yasen(1): This is a night battle? Well that's fine, I'll give it a try. Roma, charging forward!
442.Yasen(2): Alright! We'll point our cannons directly to the enemy ships. Fire, Fire!
442.MVP: Ah!? It's me... Uhm... Is it me again? Well, whatever. I do feel happy though.
442.Damaged(1): Tsk... that hurt.　I'll remember this.
442.Damaged(2): Iya... t-that place is... that's not bad, I'll show you this time!
442.Damaged(3): Direct hit!? Am I done for? W-Well, I'm still fine. I won't sink this time!
442.Sunk: Wa...N-no way... I'm sinking, again? That's ridiculous... No... Nee-san...
442.2@NewYears: Buon anno! Admiral, best wishes for the coming year. Nee-san and I, Roma, will be counting on you for another year.
442.2@Setsubun: Set-tsu-boohn...? No, you pronounce it differently. "Setsubunga." Isn't that right? Eh? I've got it wrong? Japanese is difficult.
442.2@Valentines: I happen to have a chocolate I made... What? You don't need it? You do? ...Ah, I see. Hmmm...
442.2@Anniversary3: Hmmm, so it's the third year. I see, well congrats to that. Maybe, I'll celebrate it too. Wha-what is it?
442.2@Rainy: The rainy season... Hmm, so this is the rainy season. There's a lot of rain, but there's also less air raids, so I guess it's not that bad.
442.2@EarlySummer: It has become considerably hot... Summer is soon. Neesan, I want to buy a new swimsuit. Hmm.
442.2@Summer: Nee-san? Are you going to go swim with the Admiral? It can't be helped— I'll accompany you as well. I've bought a swimsuit too, after all.
442.2@Xmas: Buone Feste. Admiral, Merry Christmas. However... nee-san, you're overdoing it a bit... ...geez...
442.2@YearsEnd: End of the year cleaning, huh? I suppose it's necessary. Nee-san's room is a disaster. I'll have to help her out.
442.2@Spring: Spring... Hmm... so this... is a sakura... It's not bad. Eh, flower viewing? ...Should I...?
442.2@WhiteDay: What... is this? Return for the chocolate? Hmm, Japan's culture sure is dutiful. I'll accept it this once.
442.2@Anniversary2018: Congratulations, Admiral. I am a little happy to spend this day of celebration with you. I'm serious.

447.Poke(1): Fourth ship of the Vittorio Veneto-class Battleships, Roma, in combat position.
447.Join: Battleship, Roma, sortieing! Nee-san, I'll be fine, don't worry.
447.Battle: Enemy fleet sighted! Commencing artillery fire. I'll destroy you with all my might... Open all the gunports!
447.Attack: Battleship, Roma, commencing artillery fire. Main artillery, fire!
447.Yasen(1): I've grown used to night battles now... Follow after me! All ships, charge forward!
447.Yasen(2): Triple cannons are not toys. Alright? I'll show you what's what!
447.Damaged(1): Tsk... that hurt. But it's nothing compared to what I've been through...!
447.Damaged(2): Iya... t-that place is... damn, I'll show you this time!
447.H0000: The date has changed, Admiral. I, Roma, will be your secretary of the day. What? Do you object?
447.H0100: 01...0...0... I'm still not used to this style yet. I did it correctly, right? Right?
447.H0200: 02...0...0... Zero-Two... Zero... Zero... Yes, perfect. I got it down.
447.H0300: 03...0...0... It's already three o'clock... Are you not getting sleepy, Admiral?
447.H0400: 04...0...0... Isn't it already morning? As expected, keeping at it every day seems bad for the skin.
447.H0500: 05...0...0... I'm going to wake everyone up, okay? Admiral... you are sleepy now?
447.H0600: 06...0...0... Well then, what should we do about breakfast? Is yesterday's bread fine with you?
447.H0700: 07...0...0... Admiral. You looked sleepy so I made some cappuccino. Do you need another?
447.H0800: 08...0...0... Well then, let's get to work. Let's send out the fleet. To the West? South?
447.H0900: 09...0...0... So that's the Japanese Fast Battleship Kirishima? Hmmm...
447.H1000: 10...0...0... Eh, with Kirishima? I see. I do feel like trying to go up against her at least once as well.
447.H1100: 11...0...0... It's already noon... Time flies. What do you want to do for lunch? Mamiya's, perhaps?
447.H1200: 12...0...0... Japanese lunch is pretty simple, isn't it? I wonder if it can last till nighttime.
447.H1300: 13...0...0... That dish called katsu curry surprise me a little. Is it a type of risotto? Unique, isn't it? It's powerful.
447.H1400: 14...0...0... Bismarck? Yes, I do know her, albeit only the name. She's famous, you know.
447.H1500: 15...0...0... Ah, Kirishima? What is it? Did you need me for something? Ah, my glasses?
447.H1600: 16...0...0... I got a little nervous. Kirishima... doesn't seem like a bad person, right?
447.H1700: 17...0...0... The sun is setting. I'm worn out today too. How about you, Admiral? Is that so?
447.H1800: 18...0...0... Admiral, what do you want to do for dinner? Eh, Kongou? Kirishima? What's happening!?
447.H1900: 19...0...0... What is the "Fast Battleship Union?" Wha- whaaa—!? Me too? Whaaa!?
447.H2000: 20...0...0... This white wine known as "Nihonshu"... is good! You drinking, Admiral?
447.H2100: 21... Phew... They finally went back. Do Japanese battleships not have any sense of shame?
447.H2200: 22...0...0... Ah, sis. It's fine, I'm doing the job properly. Don't worry.
447.H2300: 23...0...0... Eh? I reek of alcohol? I... it's the fault of Kirishima and the rest!

440.Intro: Hi! I'm the Iowa-class battleship, Iowa. You're the admiral of this fleet? Hmm... not bad! The pleasure is all mine!
440.Library: Hi! I'm the name ship of the Iowa-class battleships, Iowa. Although I'm a high-speed battleship, I'm heavily armed, and could be said to be the penultimate form of battleship. As the last of the battleship classes born in the USA, I will work hard for the fleet. Take good care of me!
440.Poke(2): Sortie? Hm... sounds good to me.
440.Poke(3): This is not a drill. I repeat, this is not a drill! Hey, Admiral!?
440.Idle: This is the Japanese fleet, huh... Ohh! That battleship has such a unique bridge. I like her. Hey! Hey, you!
440.Married: Admiral? What's wrong? Are you tired? Okay, it's fine if you take a quick nap. It's fine. I don't mind.
440.Equip(1): Oh, this is great! It'll really help.
440.Docking(1): Time for some quick repairs... I think I'll take a shower.
440.Docking(2): Oh, shit... I'm starting to feel indebted to Japan's amazing baths...
440.Construction: Okay! A new ship is finished being built. I can't wait to meet the new friend!
440.Battle: Now, time to show you my overwhelming firepower. Open fire!
440.Attack: Fire! Fire! Ahaha! Let's go! Let's get them!
440.Yasen(1): I'm a fast battleship, so don't even think of running. Night battle— let's get this started!
440.Yasen(2): I'm not a name ship for nothing, y'know. Fufufu♪ Let's finish this.
440.MVP: I'm the most valuable!? Really? Thanks! *♥*
440.Damaged(3): Ouch! You've done it now... I'll get you back for this... it's a promise, damn it!
440.Sunk: Oh my god... I lost...? The water is... it's hard to see... Admi... ral...
440.2@NewYears: A happy new year. Admiral, I hope I can count on you again this year.
440.2@Setsubun: What? Setsuboon... What's that? Well, I've never heard of it...
440.2@Valentines: Why? Why are all of you making chocolate? Because it's Valentines? Eh, but why?
440.2@Rainy: It's raining so much at this time of year. "To-you" is what you call it...? As in, "for you"? What a romantic season. That's Japan for you.
440.2@Fall: Japan in autumn is... ... ... ...Ah...! This beer is amazing! Eh? There's a kind of beer made just for autumn? Japan... is incredible, isn't it?
440.2@Saury: Saury? What? But why saury...? Fishing... support? The Combined Fleet sure has it rough.
440.2@Spring: Great! The cherry blossoms are beautiful! This is good! I like it! Flower viewing? I'm interested!
440.2@WhiteDay: White Day? ... What's 'white' about it? Cookies? Admiral, why? Uh, no... I'll gladly accept it, though...
440.2@EarlySummer: Japanese summers sure are hot~ What are you doing, Yamato? ...Having a summer holiday? In a swimsuit? Heee~
440.2@Anniversary2018: It's the 5th Anniversary, right, Admiral? Congratulations. Great! Please look after me and the other Americans in the coming year too!

360.Intro: Hi! I'm the Iowa-class battleship, Iowa. Admiral, how've you been? Doing okay? Well then, let's do our best today! Go! Go!
360.Equip(2): Harpoon? Mmm... it's not bad, but... isn't it too soon for that? You can wait... can't you?
360.Attack: If you think the age of battleships is over, then pay attention. Fire!
360.Friend44(1): The battleships from your country have come too... Aha, OK, I like interesting things. Let's get along.
360.H0000: Today I'll be your secretary ship. That okay? Hmhm! Leave it to me.
360.H0200: Two o'clock now. Is that fine?
360.H0300: It's three o'clock now. *sigh* I'm falling asleep.
360.H0400: Four o'clock now. It's almost morning... *yawn* ...Admiral, you up?
360.H0600: 6 o'clock! Admiral, I'll make you some scrambled eggs this morning, okay? Ah, please help yourself to the coffee! Okay?
360.H0700: 7 o'clock. Alright, let's begin our morning duties! What do you want to do first?
360.H0800: It's 8 o'clock. Alright, let's proceed with the fleet maneuvers. Go! Go!
360.H0900: 9 o'clock. *whew* This should wrap up our morning duties, right? Is that okay?
360.H1000: 10 o'clock! Eh!? You're mean you're really still working? Japan's fleets are so hard-working...
360.H1100: It's 11 o'clock! Admiral, what are you having for lunch? Huh? Steak!? I'll tag along!
360.H1200: It is noon! Alright, let's sit down and enjoy our lunch!
360.H1300: Mamiya restaurant, huh... I've heard rumors. Ohhh! So this is a traditional Japanese lunch? Great! I'll dig right in!
360.H1400: Yeah... the portions are a little small, but traditional Japanese lunches aren't half bad. The fact that it's also healthy is great! Ah! It's 2 o'clock now. I forgot.
360.H1500: 3 o'clock! Hey! Yamato! Let's have it out for real next time! During an exercise, of course! It's a drill, only a drill!
360.H1600: 4 o... ohhhh! The Kongou sisters! Japan's fast battleships are really pretty! Huh? Kirishima, why are you angry? What's wrong?
360.H1700: It's 5 o'clock. Japanese sunsets are so beautiful! Admiral, it's wonderful!
360.H1800: It's 6 o'clock! Admiral? What are we going to have for dinner? Ohh!? Yamato will? I'm excited for that! Let's go!
360.H1900: 7 o'clock. Yamato, thanks for the invitation for dinner! I'm just going to help myself to the Yamato Hotel dinner.
360.H2000: 8 o'clock. Yamato Hotel's dinner was great! Huh? I'm praising you. Yamato, what's wrong?
360.H2100: 9 o'clock! Oh, that's why. What are you saying, Yamato? You're a great battleship! You're beautiful!
360.H2200: It's 10 o'clock! Admiral, we did a good job today! Great!
360.H2300: 11 o'clock! Well then, let's finish it up for the day! Good night!

601.Intro: Hi, I'm one of the Big Seven from the States, the 1st ship of the Colorado-class battleships, USS Colorado. So you're the Admiral? Not too shabby. Make sure you stick real close to me. What do you say?
601.Library: I'm one of the Big Seven from the States, 1st ship of the Colorado-class battleships, BB-45 USS Colorado. Yes, I was born in New York and assigned to the Pacific Fleet at Pearl Harbor. But, I was in the dock back home when the attack happened... Oh well. I'll show you what a Big Seven can really do. Just you wait.
601.Poke(3): You're being a bit too casual with me. Listen here, I'm one of the Big Seven and a lead ship to boot. Show some more reverence and respect... Eh, Mutsu, what is it? I'm going too far? Eeh!?
601.Idle: Nagato, Mutsu, what's up? "Teitoku"? Ah, the Admiral. I don't know where he is. I haven't seen him for a while.
601.Married: Ahem. Admiral, I made some coffee. Please have some if you'd like. It's hot.
601.Wedding: Admiral? What's this ring for? ...Eh, it's for me? It's so beautiful! Thank~ you~! I'll always treasure it!
601.Join: USS BB-45, Colorado-class nameship, Colorado. I'm heading out. Follow... me!
601.Docking(2): I'm going to get some rest. What? You got a problem with that?
601.Sortie: Pacific Fleet flagship, battleship Colorado, sortieing. Is everyone ready? We'll drive them before us! Weigh anchor!
601.Battle: Enemy in sight! Now, let's get started. Crush them!
601.Yasen(1): All ships, follow me! We'll annihilate them at night!
601.MVP: I'm number one? A battle star? Alright, I accept. Everyone, feel free to use me as your role model.
601.Damaged(3): Oh my God! I've been hit? Look at what you've done now.
601.Sunk: Oh my... God... Someone like me is... sinking... into this sea? ...The water is cold... Cold and... dark...
601.SpCutin: Colorado Squadron, full broadside! Open fire when you've confirmed the targets! We'll destroy them in one shot. Fire!
601.2@Rainy2019: So it gets pretty rainy here around this season, huh? I prefer when it's sunny. Wee Vee, how about you?
601.2@Fall2019: The Naval District Autumn Festival... This is nice. The atmosphere of the festivals in this country is... Ah, what is that destroyer eating? I'd like to try some.
601.2@Saury2019: So this is the Saury Festival I've heard about. It's a lot larger than I imagined. Since I'm here, I'd like to try one of those "salt grilled saury"! Can I?

1496.Intro: Hi, one of the Big Seven from the States, 1st ship of the Colorado-class battleships, USS Colorado, arriving on station. Admiral, make sure you stick real close to me today too. What do you say? OK!
1496.Poke(1): Did you call me? What's up?
1496.Poke(2): I fight for your... I fight for all of your sakes. That's what I want!
1496.Attack: My modernization remodel isn't just for show. Fire!
1496.MVP: I'm number one? A battle star? Alright, I accept. It's thanks to all of you. Thanks.
1496.H0000: If I must. I, Colorado, will be your secretary for today. Just for today. Don't misunderstand me.
1496.H0100: It is 1. Well, something like this?
1496.H0200: It is 2. Mutsu said it was "ushimitsu", right?
1496.H0300: It is 3. Even I'm getting sleepy. Shall we get some rest?
1496.H0400: It's 4. You're still going to keep going? Really?
1496.H0500: It's 5. Morning is almost here. I've got no choice then. I'll make some coffee. You'll have some, right?
1496.H0600: Good morning. It is 6. Now, let's go wake the fleet up. *deep breath* Nngggh. It's a great morning.
1496.H0700: It is 7. I've made breakfast. Scrambled eggs are fine, right? Here you go.
1496.H0800: It is 8. Now, let's head out to sea! What operations will we be doing today? Eh, long-term docking? I refuse.
1496.H0900: It is 9. Ah, Mary? Yes, I feel like I'll see them again. Those girls are tougher than they look.
1496.H1000: It is 10. Ah, the shape of my bridge? I don't dislike it. Do you not like it? Hmm, OK.
1496.H1100: Elevenses. Shall we have lunch soon? I guess it's still early... I've brought a lunch box today.
1496.H1200: It is noon. Come on, open it up. Well? It's my special sandwich lunch box! Isn't it grand? Help yourself.
1496.H1300: It is 1. Would you like some coffee after your meal? OK.
1496.H1400: It is 2. Now, can we do some exercises this afternoon?
1496.H1500: It is 3. Oh, Nelson! Are you doing fine?
1496.H1600: It is 4. Right, double line... But, don't you think you shouldn't ignore echelon? You can face both forwards and broadside.
1496.H1700: It is 5. The sun is sinking below the sea. It's beautiful. I like this magic hour. What about you?
1496.H1800: It is 6. Now, I'll go get dinner ready. The menu will be New York cut steak. Just wait.
1496.H1900: It is 7. There, the steak is done. Eat up before it gets cold. Is beer fine for your drink?
1496.H2000: It is 8. We're just having a meal, but the port is a bit too noisy. The 3rd Squadron? ...Ah, they sortied.
1496.H2100: It is 9. Ah, if I'm not mistaken, you're... Yamashiro? Eh, Wee Vee? She's not here. Ah, is that so? OK.
1496.H2200: It is 10. No, it's fine. Yamashiro might not act like it, but she's a girl that loves her sister. I don't dislike that.
1496.H2300: It is 11. Look at the time. Tomorrow? I'll help you with whatever you want tomorrow. ...Ah! I... I've got no choice then!

439.Intro: I am known as the Queen Elizabeth-class battleship, Warspite. Admiral, I'll be relying on you.
439.Library: Queen Elizabeth-class battleship, second ship, Warspite here. Admiral, the pleasure is mine. I'm a genuine born and bred British battleship. The Home Fleet, the Mediterranean and the Indian Ocean were all locations I was deployed to. Remember my name, Admiral. Be sure to engrave it into your memory.
439.Poke(3): What's this? Admiral, what on earth do think you're doing with that hand of yours? Would you kindly explain?
439.Idle: Admiral, are you free now...? Oh... you look busy... It can't be helped. I know, I'll go visit the Kongou girls in their room.
439.Married: My Admiral, what's wrong? You don't seem well. Hmmmm... that's it! I'll prepare some black tea and muffins. Tea time will definitely make you feel all better.

Wedding.0: My Admiral? Why are you calling?
Wedding.14050,17372: I'll be with you 'til death do us part!

439.Join: Sally go! Main fleet, weigh anchor!
439.Equip(1): This is a good armament. Thank you very much, indeed.
439.Equip(2): A Japanese weapon? It isn't bad. I quite like it.
439.Supply: I am much obliged for your kindness.
439.Docking(1): I'll be in the docks for a bit. See you later.
439.Docking(2): Admiral, I'll fall back to the rear for repairs. Keep in touch.
439.Construction: A new ship has been completed. It was good, wasn't it?
439.Sortie: Battleship Warspite, sortieing! Fleet, follow me!
439.Battle: Enemy ship is in sight. Open fire!
439.Yasen(1): So you think you can run from me? Amusing. Fleet, increase speed! Begin pursuit.
439.MVP: I'm number one? I beg to differ. It was all because of everyone putting up a good fight. Isn't that right, Admiral?
439.Sunk: I'm the one who is sinking? ...So... this is... how I'll fall on the battlefield...
439.Friend41(1): The European Combined Grand Fleet, flagship Warspite, has arrived at the battlefield. Now we'll support the friend fleet. All ships, charge!
439.2@NewYears: Best wishes for a happy new year, Admiral!
439.2@Setsubun: Setsuboon? If I'm not mistaken, those girls did mention it... Ah, Kongou, it's Setsuboon! Eh? Why are you laughing? Why is that? ...Why!?
439.2@Valentines: My Admiral, this is for you. It seems to be a tradition in this fleet. Eh, it's not?
439.2@Fall: Japan in autumn. How pleasant... this atmosphere. I quite like it. The food is delicious, too.
439.2@Saury: Saury? The fish? Battleships providing support with fishing... The Japanese fleet is certainly quite nice! I'd also like to take part!
439.2@Xmas: Admiral! Happy Christmas! Let's have a drink today. Cheers! It's such a lovely day.
439.2@Rainy: Rainy Days... hmm... Admiral... hmm... no it's nothing in particular. It's just on rainy days I tend to feel down. Strange, isn't it?
439.2@WhiteDay: Admiral, this one is for me? I don't know how to thank you enough!
439.2@EarlySummer: A swimsuit? I see. I shall take it into consideration. Hmmm... What should I do?
439.2@Summer2017: Summer in Japan is rather intense. I really want to dress lighter in this heat. I really do.
439.2@LateFall2017: My old wounds start to ache when it gets cold. I think the Fritz X was just foul play. Whenever I think of it... Ow... owowowow... I'm fine.
439.2@Anniversary2018: Congratulations on the 5th Anniversary. Thank you very much, Admiral.
439.3@Saury2018: So this is how the Naval Base Saury Festival is opening this year. Aah, it kind of takes me back!
439.4@Saury2018: I'll help out too. Let me help. Please! Ah, this is a nice radish. I'll grate it.
439.2@Anniversary2019: I congratulate it. It's our anniversary, Admiral. Thank you, and congratulations.
439.3@EventShingle: We need to find Janus, and bring her home.
439.3@Fall2019: The place where Akagi, Yamato, and Nisshin were born? I'm sure it's a wonderful place. I can't wait to see it. What's delicious over there? Nikujaga?
439.2@Fall2019: Kure Naval District? The home of the Japanese Fleet. I wonder what kind of place it is. I would like to go too.

364.Friend42(1): Warspite, roger that! Begin the attack!
364.Friend42(2): Sorry to keep you waiting! Battleship Warspite has arrived on the battlefield! We'll now back you up. Are you ready, Nelson? Let's go!
364.Friend42(3): Sorry to keep you waiting! Battleship Warspite has arrived on the battlefield! We'll now back you up.
364.Friend45(1): The European Combined Grand Fleet, flagship Warspite, has arrived at the operation area. We will not support the friendly fleets. All ships, attack!
364.Friend45(2): Her Majesty's Ship, Warspite, has arrived to provide support. Come around the front of the enemy. Open fire!
364.H0000: Admiral, the date has changed. I shall serve as flagship of the fleet for today.
364.H0100: It's one o'clock. I hope that tone of voice was good.
364.H0200: It's two o'clock now. The late night is so quiet. I'm rather fond of this hour.
364.H0300: It's three o'clock now. Shall I brew some black tea? You'll drink some, right?
364.H0400: It's four o'clock now. It's nearly daybreak. Admiral, aren't you a bit tired?
364.H0500: Good morning, Admiral! It's five o'clock now.
364.H0600: It's six o'clock now. Would you like a cup of black tea for the morning? Or would you prefer some strong coffee?
364.H0700: It's seven o'clock now. Admiral, breakfast is ready!
364.H0800: It's eight o'clock now. Well, let's begin with fleet operations for the day. I'll begin by assembling the battleship forces.
364.H0900: It's nine o'clock now. Those girls are ...Nagato... and Mutsu, correct? ...Hello! It's quite an honour.
364.H1000: It's ten o'clock now. Fuso class? Great! What a lovely and unique superstructure! Quite the sense of artistry. Indeed, even I can appreciate it!
364.H1100: It's eleven. Aviation... battleship? Super multi-plane... Zuiun? ...That's quite complicated. Japan's battleships are very intricate.
364.H1200: It is noon. Is that the renowned Yamato-class...? They're certainly amazing. So great...
364.H1300: It's one o'clock. Let's have lunch. I made some ham sandwiches. You can have them with some black tea! Please!
364.H1400: It's two o'clo... Oh, my! The Kongou sisters! You're looking full of spirit. That's wonderful.
364.H1500: It's three o'clock now. Kongou, what's wrong? ...Are you angry? Why?
364.H1600: It's four o'clock now. Admiral, those girls... how scandalous. Ships from that country are here, too. ...Eh? ...They're good girls? Really? I... see... I'll go greet them, then. Hello!
364.H1700: It's five o'clock now. It's beautiful... the sunset. How pretty. Ever since arriving in this fleet, I've always loved the scenery. ...So lovely.
364.H1800: It's six o'clock now. The sun is setting. Time to bring the fleet home to port.
364.H1900: It's seven o'clock now. You'll be making dinner, Admiral...? Will you be alright? Do you need me to help?
364.H2000: It's eight o'clock now. Delicious! Admiral, your cooking is delicious! The Japanese fleet... the Japanese Admiral is so amazing...! *sigh*
364.H2100: It's nine o'clock now. Ah, if I'm not mistaken, those are Italian heavy cruisers. Hello! ...Wait, what? Why are you running!? W-Wait!
364.H2200: It's ten o'clock now. My, Italia-san... Roma-san. Eh? Fri... tz...? Ah, that's not good. It's out of the question. I'm... not good with it...
364.H2300: It's eleven o'clock now. Admiral, thank you for your hard work today. Sweet dreams.

571.Intro: My name is Nelson. So you're my Admiral? Humph, I see. Good. Show me how you command. I have high expectations.
571.Library: I'm the 1st ship of the Nelson-class battleships, Nelson. That's right, I have a special design where all of my triple gun turrets are arranged at the front of the ship. As someone who was one of the Big 7 and flagship of my Home Fleet, I have an impressive presence. What? The arrangement of my main guns is problematic? Think before you tell British jokes. I'll forgive you just this once.
571.Poke(1): What did you want from me? Hmm? Is that so?
571.Poke(2): That's right. If we all do our part... we can win!
571.Poke(3): Hmm, what is it? ...Heh. That attempt was so weak. Alright then, I'll teach you how to do the Nelson Touch personally. Listen well, stand up against that wall. Here we go!
571.Idle: My Admiral, Zuiun, Ashika... what are you talking about? Ah, about Operation Sea Lion? Don't worry, I have it all planned out. Leave it to me. Eh, that's not it?
571.Married: What's wrong, my Admiral? You've got a long face. Mmm, I know, let's have tea time. Hot black tea is the best thing for times like this. Come on, I'll go and make some. Just wait a while.
571.Wedding: What are you being so formal for, Admiral? Are you giving that small box to me? What's going on? This isn't like you. Since you've gone through the trouble, I'm opening it...... Whoa, how is it? Does it suit me? Aha! Ahem, I adore you too.
571.Ranking: Information... Good. It's important to check the situation. What? You want me to get it? What? Why?
571.Join: Yes, I'm heading out. No, this is what a Big 7 does. Don't worry.
571.Equip(2): Hmmm, I guess... this works too. Thank you.
571.Equip(3): Alright, let's bring out the rum!
571.Supply: Alright, it's all done. I can do this.
571.Docking(1): This scratch doesn't even count as damage... But if you insist.
571.Docking(2): They got me good... Sorry. I'll be heading to the rear for a while.
571.Construction: Is it a new comrade? Let's give them our blessing.
571.Return: The fleet has returned. Yes, home port is always a great place.
571.Sortie: 1st ship of the Nelson-class battleships, Nelson, sortieing! All ships, don't fall behind!
571.Battle: Enemy is in sight. Let's get started now, you lot!
571.Yasen(2): I expect that each ship will do their duty. Forwards!
571.Yasen(1): All ships, charge into the heart of the enemy in double line! Didn't you hear me? Double line! Let's go!
571.MVP: Oh? A battle honour? It's been a while since I felt like this. But, it's... not bad. Thank you very much indeed.
571.Damaged(1): Ngh, it's just a scratch! There's no problem at all.
571.Damaged(2): Whoa! Tch, that was pretty good. Interesting!
571.Damaged(3): Y-you... to reduce someone called the "Big 7" like me to this state... I won't sink yet, just watch.
571.Sunk: I see... So this is... what they mean by "sinking"... So this is... falling in battle... Dark... so dark... I... see...
571.SpCutin: Nelson Touch. Main guns 1 and 2, one more shot!
571.2@Saury2018: What!? What's all this racket!? Oi, what's going on, Ark? What? Saury? By "Saury" you mean that fish? What's with that equipment...?
571.2@Fall2018: It's getting colder. If I recall correctly, Rodney doesn't like the cold... No, I'm mistaken. Oh well. What's for dinner tonight? I see, a hotpot? That's good. It'll warm me up.
571.2@Xmas2018: Happy Christmas, my Admiral. Alright, let's drink tonight! Cheers!
571.2@NewYears2019: It's the new year. My Admiral, I'm counting on you this year too. Alright, now let's have a toast. Is rum fine? Cheers!
571.3@Setsubun2019: How dare you Nagato, you avoided the first salvo... Recalculate the firing solution. Here goes the 2nd salvo... Whoa! Wh-who did that!? Ark! Damn you!
571.2@Setsubun2019: Oooh, so this is the much rumoured Settsubuun. Nice. I like having fun experiencing foreign cultures. So I throw this at Nagato? Alright, leave it to me. Here I go!
571.2@Valentines2019: Y-you! Do you like... sw-sweet things? ...Re-really!? Then, this is for you. This is a parting gift... No, it's my feelings!
571.2@WhiteDay2019: This is... from you? ...I-I see! Thank you. I-I gladly accept. You don't need to thank me.
571.2@Spring2019: "Sakura"... That's what they call this flower here. I wonder why... it gives off such a sad feeling even though it's beautiful. What a strange flower.
571.3@Anniversary2019: The 6th Anniversary? Isn't that amazing? Congratulations. Accept my blessings.
571.2@Rainy2019: Ahaam, so this is the fabled "tsooyu" of this region? Well... it's fine, isn't it? Listening to the rain while drinking... Nothing bad about that.

576.Intro: I'm Nelson. You're looking well today. That's the best. Heh, show me how you command today as well. I'm counting on you, my Admiral.
576.Poke(1): Are you that interested in the arrangement of my main guns? Hmm... I see! That's great. As expected of my Admiral. You've got good eyes!
576.Equip(2): Hmm, this might be a good pick. Thank you.
576.Sortie: 1st ship of the Nelson-class battleships, fleet flagship Nelson, sortieing! All ships, don't fall behind! Follow me!
576.MVP: Hmm, a battle honour? It's all thanks to your command, my Admiral. But, it's... not bad. Thank you very much indeed.
576.Friend42(1): Battleship Nelson, roger. I'll show you what I can do. We'll attack in double line! Split the enemy down the middle. Let's go!
576.Friend42(2): I've kept you waiting. Home Fleet flagship, Nelson, has arrived! Let's go! Each should do their duty! Charge!
576.H0000: Very well, I'll be by your side today, Admiral. Ah, really? Of course! Alright, the time just turned exactly 12am.
576.H0100: 1 o'clock. Yes, you need this for the night shift. Do you want some? I see, alright, let's have a toast! Yes, you can sure drink.
576.H0200: 2 o'clock. Well, we shouldn't drink too much. Let's slow down. Hmm, who is it at this time...? Hmm? It's Ark! What's the matter?
576.H0300: 3 o'clock. I see, you can't sleep. Well, shall we just drink some rum then, my Admiral? Ehe, excuse me. We can? Ah, really? You're so understanding. Outstanding!
576.H0400: 4 o'clock. Ah, no, I've heard enough about Swordfish, Ark. You've drunk too much... How about some water... Ah, sorry, my Admiral; thanks.
576.H0500: 5 o'clock. Ark is finally asleep. My apologies, my Admiral. No, thanks a lot. Ahahaha, it's already morning.
576.H0600: 6 o'clock. I see, like this? All hands, assemble! Ngh, aaaah. What a lovely morning. Alright, I'll go and make some hot black tea. You'll have some right?
576.H0700: 7 o'clock. Breakfast is important. Of course we're having a full breakfast, right? Hmm, where's my share, Admiral?
576.H0800: 8 o'clock. You couldn't have really expected me to make breakfast... That was a good English joke. Your full breakfast tasted good, my Admiral. Your cooking is delicious. Outstanding!
576.H0900: 9 o'clock. Now, shall we put to sea? ...Oh, Lady. You're looking wonderful today too. I expect nothing less. That's right, shall we have some exercises to help digest the meal? Will you do me the honour?
576.H1000: 10 o'clock. Ah, this turret arrangement? Isn't it great? I can bring maximum firepower to bear on either flank. My rear? No comment! Well, it's not a problem!
576.H1100: 11 o'clock. It's almost noon. Now that you mention it, I am feeling a little hungry. What about you, my Admiral? Hmmm.
576.H1200: It's midday. Oh, who's that destroyer? Hey, Lucky Jervis! What? What are these sandwiches? Whoa, thank you. You really are lucky.
576.H1300: 1 o'clo... Ah, whoa, you've come... You're Nagato, Japan's Big 7! How about it? Have an exercise with me... Ah, I see. Alright, then I won't hold back! Come, Nagato!
576.H1400: 2 o'clock. Humph, you're pretty good, Nagato. That's how it needs to be. Shall we go another round?
576.H1500: 3 o'clock. Aaaah, I worked up a good sweat. Oh? Thanks for the iced tea! *gulp* *gulp*... Ahaaaa! Thanks, Mutsu. You've got a capable little sister too, Nagato. *gulp* *gulp*... Aaaaah! Yes, it's delicious!
576.H1600: 4 o'clock. So it's become evening while we were travelling. Oh, that silhouette is... I see, it's the Yamato-type. She's... Ehe, yes, she's beautiful.
576.H1700: 5 o'clock. Now, it's almost time for dinner. What's on tonight's menu, my Admiral? Your cooking is delicious. I can't wait.
576.H1800: 6 o'clock. Ooh, so these are fuukaten. They look like scotch eggs. Let's see. *nom* *nom* Mmmm! It's delicious! How about opening a shop after the war is over? I can even be the owner.
576.H1900: 7 o'clock. Yes, your cooking goes well with not only rum, but scotch too. Alright, let's drink today. It's fine, right? Right?
576.H2000: *gulp* *gulp* Aaaaaah. I think it's 8 o'clock? You're doing well too. That's great. The torpedo squadrons are being noisy for some reason... Oh, well. Let's leave them be. Anyway, give me another glass.
576.H2100: 9 o'clock. Oh, it's the little Italian girl? What, you want to join us? Alright, come here. Now, have a glass. Oooh, not bad. Yes!
576.H2200: 10 o'clock. Oh, Sheffield! What's wrong? What? You got caught up with DesRon3 in a night battle? Ahahahaha! Oh well! How about a glass?
576.H2300: 11 o'clock. Spending the day with you was so much fun. I'm counting on you tomorrrow too. Good night, my Admiral. Have a good night.

Library.28730,31100: You can just leave this to me!

512.H0700: 0700. Hmph, that was easy. Right, next is breakfast. Yup, you can leave that to me too.

512.H2300: 2300. You did your best today. I'm counting on you tomorrow! Доброй ночи!

461.Intro:
First of the Shoukaku-class carriers, Shoukaku here.
I hope that the remodeled Shoukaku-class, including Zuikaku, will be a useful source of strength for you.
461.Library:
First of the Shoukaku-class carriers, Shoukaku here.

I was designed and built after the Washington Naval Treaty was denounced, and commissioned as a standard large-scale aircraft carrier. Along with my younger sister Zuikaku, we form the Fifth Carrier Division.

After a tragic event, we succeeded our senpai and continued to support the front lines. And now, having gotten through Marianas, I wish to continue flying onward with the admiral.
